steps.title:
Welcome to the Convertigo No Code Studio
Product Tour!
steps.intro: Learn how to create instantly No Code Apps

steps.title:
You can use one of our Single Sign On options here.
We also support SAMLv2 and LDAP for Enterprises
steps.intro: Please, select an authentication method to proceed to next step.

steps.title: Here is your dashboard. In here you will find all your Apps you are building
steps.intro:
_ "Forms edition" allows you to see all the applications you created or that are shared with you as a collaborator.
 _ "Published Forms" allows you to see all the applications you published and those that are shared with you.
 _ The "No-Code Database" tab is the list of all the databases that have been created by you or shared with you.

steps.title: This is where you create a new empty App or based on an existing template
Let's add a new App!
steps.intro: Click the + icon to create a new App.

steps.title: Just name it Demo App
steps.intro:
Write "Demo App" in the 'Title' field.
Click the Save button to validate.

steps.title: GDPR
steps.intro: We have here a GDPR notice a system administrator may have configured, just click ont it, once read.

steps.title: PALETTE
steps.intro: Here is the 'Palette' where you will find all the components available for your App.

steps.title: APP EDITOR
steps.intro: This is the main view of your App where you can add, modify and configure your components.

steps.title: PREVIEW
steps.intro: This button permits you to preview your App as a final user would see it.

steps.title: PUBLISH
steps.intro:
Once your App is finished, this button allows you to publish it.
You can then share it with yours users to collect responses.

steps.title: COLLABORATORS
steps.intro:
Here, you will be able to add collaborators to your App.
Collaborators can edit your App and/or view App's responses.

steps.title: Let's see in details some components of the Palette
SELECT
steps.intro:
This component is a control that provides a menu of options.
You can write your own options by hand or select data from the No Code Database.

steps.title: DATE
steps.intro: This component allows the user to pick a date in a calendar.

steps.title: CAMERA
steps.intro: This component allows the user to take a picture and add it to the App.

steps.title: DATA Grid
steps.intro: This component allows you to present data in a table to the user. These data come from data sources.

steps.title: IMPORT FILE
steps.intro: This component allows the user to import files to the App.

steps.title: SIGNATURE
steps.intro: This component allows the user to affix his signature.

steps.title: Now, let's see some special components of the Palette that are triggered when the user fill the App and/or when the responses are submitted
ACTIONS - Submit responses
steps.intro: This component adds an action that is triggered when the user submit responses to your App. These actions can be chained and will be executed sequentially in order.

steps.title: DATE
steps.intro: This component allows the user to pick a date in a calendar.

steps.title: CONGRATULATIONS!
steps.intro:
You finished the No Code Studio Product Tour.
Now it's your turn!
